conclusion: Plan to analyze the p-V diagram and use given information to calculate temperature at state C.
The p-V diagram shows the process from state A to B horizontally, then to C vertically. Pressure at A is 3 × 10^5 Pa, volume at C is 4 × 10^-3 m^3.
The gas undergoes a process from state A to C, involving a horizontal path from A to B and a vertical path from B to C.
Internal energy change from state A to C is 200 J.
Temperature at state A is -73°C, equivalent to 200 K.
Since the process is isothermal from A to B, internal energy change from A to B is zero.
Internal energy change from B to C is also 200 J.
Internal energy of an ideal gas is given by U = (3/2)NkT.
Substitute N = 6.0 × 10^23 mol^-1 and k = 1.38 × 10^-23 J/K.
Calculate T_C and find it to be 273 K.
